thread.title: Watch the three OUTRAGEOUS goals up for the 2016 Fifa Puskas Award - and vote for your favourite
thread.title_full: Watch the three OUTRAGEOUS goals up for the 2016 Fifa Puskas Award - and vote for your favourite

author: Thomas Bristow
title: Watch the three OUTRAGEOUS goals up for the 2016 Fifa Puskas Award - and vote for your favourite
text:
Get football updates directly to your inbox + Subscribe Thank you for subscribing! Could not subscribe, try again later Invalid Email 
There's nothing better in football than an outrageous goal - which is probably why everyone's favourite Fifa award (or only Fifa award they like) is the Puskas Award . 
On Monday night Fifa will be announcing 2016's winner as all the goals scored last year have been whittled down to just three - check them out in the video above. 
2015's winner was Wendell Lira, who started and then finished an incredible team move with an overhead kick. 
But it's possible this year's three contenders may well eclipse Lira's stunning effort. 
Let's take a look at the contenders: Marlone (Photo: YouTube/FIFATV) 
The Corinthians attacking midfielder finished a well worked team move back in April with a self set up bicycle kick. Daniuska Rodriguez (Photo: YouTube/FIFATV) 
Venezuela won the Womenâ€™s U-17 Sudamericano Championship, and they had Rodriguez to thank. She scored six goals in the tournament, but it was her incredible individual effort against Colombia which caught everyone's attention... and a Puskas Award nomination. Mohd Faiz Subri (Photo: YouTube/FIFATV) 
A free-kick? In the Puskas Awards? Just wait till you see it. In the Malaysian Super League Subri smacks a free-kick so bendy it makes Papiss Cisse's volley against Chelsea look tame. If this effort wins, we take full credit for our outstanding coverage of it last tear. 
You can of course vote officially for your favourite on the Fifa website here . But you can also vote unofficially in our poll below. poll loading Who should the 2016 Puskas Award? 0+ VOTES SO FAR
